medical_history.chief_complaint: Renal function decline and renal cysts
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The first patient's symptoms included reduced eGFR (45 ml/min per 1.73 m²) and renal cysts, occurring without a family history of polycystic kidney disease. The medical history indicated recurrent urinary tract infections and type 2 diabetes diagnosed at age 32 years. The second patient experienced renal insufficiency diagnosed at age 27 years with eGFR at 38 ml/min per 1.73 m², alongside congenital solitary kidney and multiple small cortical cysts. The other patients also presented with various chronic symptoms, including hypomagnesemia, chronic renal insufficiency, and gout.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Type 2 diabetes mellitus, recurrent urinary tract infections, gout, unexplained elevated liver enzymes, congenital anomalies of the urogenital tract, hypomagnesemia, chronic renal insufficiency (eGFR approximately 40 ml/min per 1.73 m²).
medical_history.family_history: Family history of congenital solitary kidney, chronic renal insufficiency, diabetes at age 37 years, frequent attacks of gout, and hypomagnesemia due to chemotherapy.
